page.title: 11PLANNING DILEMMA IN GOOLE
page.content: A large{flour mill}in Goole wanted to expand its premises to make a{new {warehouse}to store and distribute a new health food product. They complained that the{council}were taking too long to decide whether this could go ahead. The problem seems to have been that the council were worried about the new parking spaces which would be needed and the extra nuisance to people in the area. The problem, we think, is that more jobs are needed but the area has to be made as pleasant as possible for those who live there - and you can't please everyone in situations like this! Political{decisions}must be very difficult to make when there are so many different points of view to consider.
